intro: Angostura pentagyna, commonly known as the five-angled angostura, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive five-angled fruit capsules. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a somewhat hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
